paragraphs.zh-tw: This back here was my brain cancer. Isn't it nice? The key phrase is "was," phew. Having brain cancer was really,as you can imagine, shocking news for me.
paragraphs.en: 我的腦惡性腫瘤以前就在這 漂不漂亮？ 最關鍵的詞語是＂以前＂ 唷！ （鼓掌聲） 你可以想像得到 當我知道患腦癌時 真是非常震驚

paragraphs.zh-tw: I knew nothing about cancer. In Western cultures, when you have cancer, it's as if you disappear in a way.
paragraphs.en: 我對癌症一無所知 生活在西方文化 如果你得了癌症 便好像失去自己

paragraphs.zh-tw: Your life as a complex human beingis replaced by medical data: Your images, your exams, your lab values, a list of medicines. And everyone changes as well.
paragraphs.en: 一個複雜的人 卻被醫療數據取代： 你的影象 檢查報告 化驗結果 和一連串的藥物清單 所有人都變了

paragraphs.zh-tw: You suddenly become a disease on legs. Doctors start speaking a languagewhich you don't understand.
paragraphs.en: 你忽然變成一個有腳的疾病 醫生漸漸講一些難懂的語言

paragraphs.zh-tw: They start pointing their fingers at your body and your images. People start changing as well because they start dealingwith the disease, instead of with the human being.
paragraphs.en: 開始指著 你的身體和圖像 其他人也變得陌生 他們只會把你當成疾病來應付 而不是對待一個人

paragraphs.zh-tw: They say, "What did the doctor say?" before even saying, "Hello." And in the meanwhile, you're left with questionsto which nobody gives an answer. These are the "Can I?" questions: Can I work while I have cancer? Can I study? Can I make love?Can I be creative? And you wonder, "What have I doneto deserve this?" You wonder, "Can I change somethingabout my lifestyle?" You wonder, "Can I do something? Are there any other options?" And, obviously, doctors arethe good guys in all these scenarios, because they are very professionaland dedicated to curing you.
paragraphs.en: 他們未跟你說聲好前 只會問：醫生説了什麼？ 當時我有很多疑問 但是沒有人回答我 這些都是＂可否＂的問題 我有癌症 可否上班？ 可否讀書？可否做愛？可否創作？ 那時覺得不解＂我做了什麼得到這樣的對待？＂ ＂可否改變自己的生活方式？＂ ＂我可否做點什麼？＂ ＂有沒有其他選擇？＂ 很明顯 醫生在這種環境 是最得人心 因為他們非常專業 而且盡心醫病

paragraphs.zh-tw: But they also are very usedto having to deal with patients, so I'd say that they sometimeslose the idea that this is torture for you and that you become,literally, a patient -- "patient" means "the one who waits." Things are changing, but classically, they tend to not engage you in any wayto learn about your condition, to get your friends and family engaged, or showing you waysin which you can change your lifestyle to minimize the risksof what you're going through. But instead, you're forced there to wait in the hands of a seriesof very professional strangers.
paragraphs.en: 但是醫生照顧病人 實在太過熟練 有時忘記了這樣治療 只會折磨你 你變成字面上 病人的稱呼 其實 等如＂一個等待的人＂ 每件事不停在變 但方式守舊 醫生不會讓你知道病情 只讓親朋戚友商量病情 也不會教你如何改善生活方式 減低疾病帶來的風險 反而要我在那裡呆等 任由那幾位陌生的大國手決定

paragraphs.zh-tw: While I was in the hospital, I asked for a printed-outpicture of my cancer and I spoke with it. It was really hard to obtain, because it's not common practiceto ask for a picture of your own cancer.
paragraphs.en: 我住院時 要求醫院給我一張自己腫瘤的圖片 好讓我跟腫瘤對話 這是很難辦到的 因為醫院通常不會允許病人這樣做

paragraphs.zh-tw: I talked to it and I said, "Okay, cancer,you're not all there is to me. There's more to me.
paragraphs.en: 我跟這圖片說： ＂腫瘤 我不只剩得你 我還擁有很多東西

paragraphs.zh-tw: A cure, whichever it is, will haveto deal with the whole of me." And so, the next day, I left the hospitalagainst medical advice. I was determined to changemy relationship with the cancer and I was determinedto learn more about my cancer before doing anythingas drastic as a surgery.
paragraphs.en: 無論什麼方法 也要待我如完整的人 第二日我不理他們的勸告 離開醫院 決心要改變我跟癌症的關係 要做重要的決定前 例如動手術 決心要先多了解自己的腫瘤

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm an artist, I use several formsof open-source technologies and open information in my practice. So my best bet was to get it allout there, get the information out there, and use it so that it could beaccessed by anyone.
paragraphs.en: 我從事藝術工作 因此可以在制作室 利用多種的網上共享技術和資料 這是我最好的辦法 從那 跟著用來研究 任何人也可以享用

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I created a website,which is called La Cura, on which I put my medical data, online. I actually had to hack it and that's a thing which wecan talk about in another speech.
paragraphs.en: 我建立了一個網站 叫做La Cura 把自己所有醫療數據 放上網 我其實入侵了那個網站 這個話題 我們留待下次演講再說

paragraphs.zh-tw: I chose this word, La Cura -- La Cura in Italian means "the cure" -- because in many different cultures, the word "cure" can meanmany different things. In our Western cultures, it means eradicatingor reversing a disease, but in different cultures, for example, a culture from Asia, from the Mediterranean,from Latin countries, from Africa, it can mean many more things.
paragraphs.en: 我決定用La Cura 這個名字 它的意大利語意思是＂cure＂ 由於不同的文化 ＂cure＂可以有不同的解釋 在我們的西方文化 它表示根絕或打敗疾病 但在不同的文化 例如文化源自亞洲 地中海 拉丁美洲 和非洲 它有很多層意思

paragraphs.zh-tw: Of course, I was interestedin the opinions of doctors and healthcare providers, but I was also interested inthe cure of the artist, of the poet, of the designer, of, who knows, the musicians. I was interested in the social cure, I was interested inthe psychological cure, I was interested in the spiritual cure, I was interested in the emotional cure, I was interested in any form of cure.
paragraphs.en: 當然 我重視醫生 保健人員的意見 但我也在意藝術家 詩人 設計師的療方 誰知道 可能是音樂家的良方 我對社交療法有興趣 對心理學療法有興趣 對心靈療法有興趣 也對情緒療法有興趣 幾乎都留意所有療法

paragraphs.zh-tw: And, it worked. The La Cura website went viral.
paragraphs.en: 最後果然有效 La Cura 網站變得非常受歡迎

paragraphs.zh-tw: I received lots of media attentionfrom Italy and from abroad and I quickly receivedmore than 500,000 contacts -- emails, social networking -- most of them were a suggestionon how to cure my cancer, but more of them were abouthow to cure myself as a full individual. For example, many thousands of videos, images, pictures, art performances were produced for La Cura.
paragraphs.en: 獲得很多意大利和海外媒體的注意 我很快收到超過50萬的聯絡 來自電郵 社交聯網 多數是提議怎樣醫好我的病 大部分人都視我為一個人 來討論療法 例如他們製造無數的影片 圖像 又做藝術表演 幫助La Cura

paragraphs.zh-tw: For example, here we seeFrancesca Fini in her performance. Or, as artist Patrick Lichty has done: He produced a 3D sculpture of my tumor and put it on sale on Thingiverse.
paragraphs.en: 例如 這是F. Fini 的演出 又或者藝術家P. Lichty 他替我的腫瘤做了一個立體雕刻品 放在Thingivese 網出售

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now you can have my cancer, too! Which is a nice thing,if you think about it, we can share our cancer. And this was going on -- scientists, the traditionalmedicine experts, several researchers, doctors -- all connected with me to give advice.
paragraphs.en: 現在你也可以擁有我的腫瘤 這是一件好事 如果你想到 大家共同感受我患癌病的經歷 這件事還有下文 科學家 醫學專家 硏究學者 醫生等 都找我提供意見

paragraphs.zh-tw: With all this information and support, I was able to form a teamof several neurosurgeons, traditional doctors, oncologists, and severalhundred volunteers with whom I was able to discuss the information I was receiving,which is very important. And together, we were able to forma strategy for my own cure in many languages,according to many cultures.
paragraphs.en: 得到這些資訊和支持後 我建立一支團隊 包括神經㚈科專家 醫生 腫瘤專家 還有數百名義工 我可以跟這批人 一同研究重要的資料 根據不同的文化 用不同的語言 研究治病的策略

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the current strategyspans the whole world and thousands of years of human history, which is quite remarkable for me. [Surgery] The follow-up MRIs showed, luckily,little to no growth of the cancer.
paragraphs.en: 現時的策略席捲全球 以至人類數千年的歷史 我覺得這是很了不起的 ［㚈科手術］ 接著我做了磁力共振 幸好病程沒有惡化

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I was able to take my time and choose. I chose the doctor I wanted to work with, I chose the hospital I wanted to stay in, and in the meanwhile, I was supportedby thousands of people, none of whom felt pity for me.
paragraphs.en: 於是我有充足的時間做決定 挑選合適的醫生 跟我並肩作戰 挑選合適的醫院入住 一時間 獲得那麼多人的支持 沒有一個是因為可憐我

paragraphs.zh-tw: Everyone felt like they couldtake an active role in helping me to get well, and this was the most importantpart of La Cura. What are the outcomes? I'm fine, as you can see, pretty fine.
paragraphs.en: 每人都很積極地 幫助我盡快復原 這是La Cura 最可貴的地方 最後的結果如何？ 我身體很好 你看我面色不錯吧！ （鼓掌聲）

paragraphs.zh-tw: I had excellent news after the surgery -- I have -- I had a very low-grade glioma, which is a "good" kind of cancerwhich doesn't grow a lot. I have completely changedmy life and my lifestyle.
paragraphs.en: 我有好消息 手術完畢後 我只有微量的膠質瘤 那是良性的腫瘤 癌細胞不再增生 我徹底了改變自己的生活方式

paragraphs.zh-tw: Everything I did was thoughtfullydesigned to get me engaged. Up until the very last fewminutes of the surgery, which was very intense, a matrix of electrodeswas implanted in my brain from this side, to be able to build a functional mapof what the brain controls.
paragraphs.en: 所有事情都盡量參與其中 甚至在手術前的片刻 時間非常緊迫 要從腦部的這一邊 植入電極矩陣 然後構成一張功能腦地圖

paragraphs.zh-tw: And right before the operation, we were able to discussthe functional map of my brain with the doctor, to understandwhich risks I was running into and if there were any I wanted to avoid. Obviously, there were.
paragraphs.en: 趕及在動手術前 大家可以跟醫生 利用這面腦地圖 討論我會遇到那些風險 如果有的 又怎樣去避開它 很明顯 那是有風險

paragraphs.zh-tw: [Open] And this openness was reallythe fundamental part of La Cura. Thousands of people sharedtheir stories, their experiences.
paragraphs.en: ［開明］ 開明真是La Cura 的核心部分 很多朋友分享他們的故事經歷

paragraphs.zh-tw: Doctors got to talk with peoplethey don't usually consult when they think about cancer. I'm a self-founding,continuous state of translation among many different languages, in which science meets emotion and conventional researchmeets traditional research.
paragraphs.en: 醫生為了硏究癌症 跟不來看病的人對話 我自發地不斷翻譯 不同的語言 做成科學跟情緒的交滙 常規研究跟傳統研究的交滙

paragraphs.zh-tw: [Society] The most important thing of La Cura was to feel like a partof a really engaged and connected society whose wellness really dependson the wellness of all of its components. This global performanceis my open-source cure for cancer.
paragraphs.en: ［社會］ La Cura 裡 最重要的事情 就是人人可以參與 互相交流的社會 每個成員的健康 都是息息相關 我的癌症療方 就是來自他們的努力成果

paragraphs.zh-tw: And from what I feel, it's a cure for me, but for us all. Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 而我覺得 這個療方屬於我的 也屬於大家的 多謝
（鼓掌聲）

title: Salvatore Iaconesi What Happened When I Open Sourced My Brain Cancer
